author: HerraHak
body:
When trying to install the 7.1.2, the installer asks me for the path to the 7.1.0 msi installer to uninstall that version.

I had to download it  but then the 7.1.2 installer fails saying it cannot remove the older version.

When I try to use the 7.1.0 msi, it cannot do anything and I receive an error.

7.1.0 msi that I used : PowerShell-7.1.0-win-x64.msi
7.1.2 : PowerShell-7.1.2-win-x64.msi

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @HerraHak Would it be possible for you to provide a repro with either a GIF or a video showing the installation issues.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I guess the OS was damaged.
We should check the scenario on clean system.

comments.author: HerraHak
comments.body:
I successfully updated powershell on another pc so I guess there might be something wrong on the pc I tried first.
As for the video or the gif it's surprising you ask.  I would have thought logs would have been more appropriate.
I'll retry on the original pc where I had the error and try to capture the screen.

comments.author: HerraHak
comments.body:
![powershell7 2 install](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39991942/110247438-9f418980-7f6c-11eb-8840-93d18062511b.gif)
This is a gif I captured from installing the new version of powershell.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I believe if the 7.1.x MSI pkg is not able to uninstall the previous version, it relies on the previous version MSI installer to do the uninstall.  I haven't seen any reports of this issue til now and wonder if something on your system is corrupted.

comments.author: DHowett
comments.body: Yes, it seems that the Installer cache has been corrupted. The MSI installer keeps a copy of every MSI’s metadata stored in a system folder for uninstall purposes. If that is broken, uninstall can fail.

comments.author: HerraHak
comments.body:
I wonder what could have been corrupted.  I haven't remove or cleaned any cache of the sort.  This is how I always installed powershell.

Does anyone have any idea on how to fix it?

Thanks

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: You can remove the key from Registry manually or use Windows Installer CleanUp Utility. (It is unsupported.)

comments.author: HerraHak
comments.body:
I used this utility and the 7.1.2 is now installed on my machine. Crazy how mystical things can become when Windows Installer start going weird. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/fix-problems-that-block-programs-from-being-installed-or-removed-cca7d1b6-65a9-3d98-426b-e9f927e1eb4d
Fix problems that block programs from being installed or removed
The Program Install and Uninstall troubleshooter helps you automatically repair issues when you're blocked from installing or removing programs.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: The issue seems to be with the MSI installer cache.

title: When installing the 7.1.2 the msi asks for the 7.1.0 msi
